intro: Eriosema boelckei, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. It is often found in open grasslands and along rocky outcrops, where it contributes to local biodiversity. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
